subject: Re: [junit] Re: Proper use of TestReult
msgSnippet: ... No not really. Please see my reply (which isn t sent yet) to the other response to my query. L -- Laurent Duperval  We ll
messageBody:
On 16 Sep, kentbeck@... wrote:
> --- In junit@y..., Laurent Duperval <lduperval@m...> wrote:
>> I've created a test for which I want to return more than one
> assertion
>> failure
>
> Whenever I think of a feature like this, I try to boil it down to a
> test case. For example, in this case, it sounds like you want
> something like:
>
> public void testTwoFailures()
> {
> TestCase t= new TestCase("two failures") {
> public void runTest() {
> fail();
> fail();
> }
> }
>
> TestResult r= t.run();
> assertEquals(2, r.failureCount());
> }
>
> Is this what you mean?
>

No not really. Please see my reply (which isn't sent yet) to the other
response to my query.

L

--
Laurent Duperval <mailto:lduperval@...>

We'll get along fine as soon as you realize I'm God.
